examples: The text runs along the margin of the page.
The fence runs along the edge of the property line.
The cars run along the highway in a steady stream.
She pushed the stroller along the path in the park.
The old man was driving along the road at a snail's pace.
words.defineEn: together or in accompaniment
words.defineVi: cùng nhau hoặc trong đệm

examples: All members of the band equally share the band's profits.
They are all equally below the salt.
It seems clear that a compromise, half-way solution had equally been ruled out by Government, Opposition, economists, press, TV, Uncle Tom Cobleigh and all.
What he lacks in book knowledge he makes up with his street smarts and policing instincts, which often prove equally helpful to the investigation.
The CEO acknowledged that all men cannot be first, but that each employee played a crucial role in the success of the company, and that they were all valued equally.
words.defineEn: to the same amount or degree
words.defineVi: với cùng số lượng hoặc mức độ

examples: With the war in the Middle East intensifying, the president's plan for environmental reform has increasingly gone by the wayside.
It is becoming increasingly clear that something has gone seriously wrong.
A lot of companies are being boxed into a corner by these increasingly restrictive regulations.
The fact that the Champions League is increasingly dominated by English clubs just rubs salt into his wounds.
and he's increasingly hard of hearing.
words.defineEn: more and more overtime
words.defineVi: ngày càng làm thêm giờ

examples: The missed detail in the contract led to legal disputes later on.
My dentist always reminds me that a stitch in time saves nine when it comes to dental care - taking care of a small cavity now can prevent a much more serious problem later on.
Later on, aerial photos came out.
Those ears were certainly altered later on.
And KISS later on!
words.defineEn: after the time mentioned or later in the future
words.defineVi: sau thời gian được đề cập hoặc muộn hơn trong tương lai

examples: Frankly, this book sounded dull as ditchwater to me.
Quite frankly, I don't blame you.
I've tried hard and frankly haven't found anything any of the governments you've mentioned have done that is worth making a song and dancing about.
Number one is, frankly, an increased focus on sustainability.
But the most indicative descendants of them are frankly, the Persians or the Indians.
words.defineEn: used when expressing an honest opinion, even though that might upset someone
words.defineVi: được sử dụng khi bày tỏ ý kiến trung thực, mặc dù điều đó có thể làm phiền ai đó

examples: The drop is primarily among younger voters.
Cranberries are primarily harvested in the water.
Much like Obama's app, Vote Joe primarily wants access to user's contacts.
America's lack of success in Canada was primarily attributable to terrible strategy.
Virgin Galactic really caught my interest primarily because of Sir Richard Branson.
words.defineEn: for the most part
words.defineVi: hầu hết

examples: Jane sure ran a tight ship around here.
That player sure got the bird after he dropped the ball.
The boss sure aired his lungs when we lost another customer!
He felt sure about his answer during the exam.
You can be sure of that.
words.defineEn: without a doubt
words.defineVi: không nghi ngờ gì

examples: The leaves of Morus alba are commonly used as food.
Lime juice is commonly added to beverages for a refreshing twist.
Black-eyed peas are commonly used in stews, soups, salads, and traditional dishes.
Iceland moss is commonly used in traditional Scandinavian cuisine
Raw milk is commonly used in certain traditional desserts, like rice pudding and flan.
words.defineEn: used to say how frequent or usual something is
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói mức độ thường xuyên hoặc bình thường của một cái gì đó

examples: The mother gently cradled her newborn baby in her arms.
The mother gently cleaned her baby's ears with a cotton swab.
She gently touched the soft fur of the cat.
Underneath the orange tree, the leaves gently fall.
He gently rested his chin on her shoulder.
words.defineEn: in a gentle manner
words.defineVi: một cách nhẹ nhàng

examples: The market is growing rapidly.
The company is gaining ground rapidly with its new product launch.
The helicopter blades spun rapidly as it prepared for takeoff.
Peter was losing hair rapidly.
Ever since George hit his forties, his hairline has been receding rapidly.
words.defineEn: at a fast rate; in a way that is very quick
words.defineVi: với tốc độ nhanh; một cách rất nhanh chóng

examples: Luckily my bus arrived before I had time to reply.
Luckily, help arrived in the nick of time.
Luckily, my husband and I are on the same wavelength about how to raise our kids.
Luckily, the teacher kept her wits about her and was able to evacuate all of her students from the burning building.
She stumbled off the balcony, but luckily, a hedge below her broke her fall.
words.defineEn: in a fortunate manner
words.defineVi: một cách may mắn

examples: She left with barely a backward glance.
He must have leant over backward to thwart my promotion.
He clearly knew the game backward and forward and had confidence in his opinions.
They just morph into money without a backward glance.
He has been there almost 30 years and knows the place backward and forward.
words.defineEn: in or to the direction opposite to the front
words.defineVi: trong hoặc theo hướng đối diện với phía trước

examples: We visit the movie theater occasionally to escape into a different world through films.
I don't mind helping her out occasionally, but this is getting beyond a joke.
Occasionally, clueless humans or major floods disturb the nest.
Even relatively mild solar weather occasionally blocks radio communications or messes with satellites.
Occasionally, larger prey also tumbles into the fatal funnel of the pitcher plant.
words.defineEn: not frequently; sometimes
words.defineVi: không thường xuyên; Thỉnh thoảng

examples: She raised both arms above her head.
The articles in this magazine are a cut above the others.
John stands head and shoulders above Bob.
The deal was completely open and above board.
Singapore punches above its weight in the world economy.
words.defineEn: in, at, or to a higher position
words.defineVi: ở, tại, hoặc đến một vị trí cao hơn

examples: After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
You hardly made a dent in your dinner.
There were hardly a few people in the audience.
Hardly anyone stands on ceremony.
These are hardly the bread-and-butter concerns of struggling farmers.
words.defineEn: close to none; almost not
words.defineVi: gần như không; hầu như không

examples: A stream of black cars drove by.
A stream of black cars drove by.
The fast runner won the race by a wide margin.
By making her jump through the hoops?
The chef impressed the customers by his special dish of button mushrooms with crumbled feta cheese.
words.defineEn: used to refer to moving past
words.defineVi: dùng để chỉ việc di chuyển trong quá khứ

examples: He rarely fought his political battles in the open.
Langgard's music is rarely heard outside Denmark.
The teacher ruled the classroom with a heavy hand, rarely allowing any freedom or creativity.
John's elderly mother rarely left the house anymore, but when his car broke down and he needed a ride, suddenly she was up and out the door.
The couple next door is always in each other's pocket, rarely seen apart and excessively reliant on each other.
words.defineEn: on a very infrequent basis
words.defineVi: trên cơ sở rất hiếm khi

examples: He memorized her phone number so he could reach her anytime.
I always make a large batch of bolognese pasta sauce and freeze it in portions, so I can enjoy it anytime I want.
I could see that the market bubble was set to burst anytime, so I topped out while the getting was good.
Check out tips anytime.
An agreement can end anytime.
words.defineEn: at an unspecified time
words.defineVi: tại một thời điểm không xác định

examples: We are officially done from now on.
These exclusive plants officially form the cultivar, or new apple variety.
Humans officially dominate the planet, no contest.
Today the Biden administration officially made that reversal.
Still, the jury is officially out.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is authoritative or formal
words.defineVi: theo cách có thẩm quyền hoặc chính thức

examples: Surprisingly, the little café had the best coffee in town.
The little café had, surprisingly, the best coffee in town.
Surprisingly I discovered water chestnuts at the local market.
He took the criticism surprisingly well.
Surprisingly, the quiet neighborhood came alive with vibrant festivities during the annual festival.
words.defineEn: in a way that is unexpected and causes surprise
words.defineVi: trong một cách đó là bất ngờ và gây ra bất ngờ

examples: I strongly believe that competition is a good thing.
The Irish economy is performing strongly, but the devil is in the detail.
This is something I feel strongly about.
She placed her hand over her heart and felt it beat strongly.
Local residents protested so strongly that plans for a new motorway fell by the wayside.
words.defineEn: to a large extent or degree
words.defineVi: đến một mức độ lớn hoặc mức độ

examples: When I tasted the vinaigrette, I was instantly transported to a sunny Mediterranean coastline.
When I tasted the hot sauce, my taste buds were instantly awakened by its intense heat and bold flavor.
The aroma of a ripe sweet orange fills the room, instantly putting me in a good mood.
He bravely took a bite of the spicy chilli and instantly felt a fiery sensation in his mouth.
Sarah introduced her new boyfriend, Alex, to her friends at the party, and they instantly liked him.
words.defineEn: with no delay and at once
words.defineVi: không chậm trễ và ngay lập tức

examples: Tom visited us in Canada shortly before the stuff hit the fan.
The customer service representative assured me that someone would be available to assist me shortly.
Shortly after I was formally informed, the notice went out, the company buzzed with the news, and I trembled in my shoes.
Indeed, to put it shortly, he lied like a tombstone.
Shortly before my fifth birthday, my mom took her own life.
words.defineEn: in a very short time
words.defineVi: trong một thời gian rất ngắn

examples: The entrepreneur's friends in high places helped her secure funding for her startup and launch it successfully.
Despite the challenges, they stood fast and successfully completed the project.
The cleaning service offered to remove the stubborn stain from the carpet on a 'no cure no pay' basis, meaning that the homeowner would only pay if the stain was successfully removed.
Sarah knew that in order to accomplish their project successfully, she needed to play ball with her team members and actively listen to their ideas and suggestions.
Potter successfully germinated mushroom spores in her home.
words.defineEn: in a manner that achieves what is desired or expected
words.defineVi: theo cách đạt được những gì mong muốn hoặc mong đợi

examples: The seemingly harmless prank ended up causing a lot of trouble, proving that the mother of mischief is no bigger than a midge's wing.
Ray gives a chilling performance as the seemingly nice cop who goes off the deep end and starts terrorising a couple.
He was criticized by some for seemingly marrying into the fashion industry solely for fame and fortune.
When it comes to cybersecurity, there is no little enemy, and even a seemingly harmless email or file can contain a dangerous virus or malware.
The divorce of a seemingly happy couple reminded their friends and family to call no man happy till he dies, and that relationships can be fragile and subject to change.
words.defineEn: in a way that appears or gives the impression of being true, though not necessarily so
words.defineVi: theo cách xuất hiện hoặc mang lại ấn tượng là đúng, mặc dù không nhất thiết phải như vậy
